definition: initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: I wish my son would show a bit more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 主動權已轉到了我們一方。

sentences.english: Employers want to see you are taking the initiative yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你的老闆想看到你掌握了主動權。

sentences.english: The South African government had insisted that MTN retain a large element of control over the business.
sentences.chinese: 南非政府認爲MTN保留着主動權。

sentences.english: The initiative has passed to us.
An innovative model---Joint Sales Body, strong control power.
sentences.chinese: 營銷創新，自建聯銷體，獲得市場主動權。

sentences.english: I want you to take ownership of it.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你們掌握主動權。
